citeinfo.title: BEDROCK_GEOL_MM48_IN: Bedrock Geology of Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, 1:500,000, Polygon Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit: This shapefile was derived and modified from a pre-existing published paper map: Gray, H.H., Ault, C.H., and Keller, S.J., 1987, Bedrock Geologic Map of Indiana, Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 48.

descript.abstract: BEDROCK_GEOL_MM48_IN is a polygon shapefile that shows bedrock geology of the state of Indiana at a scale of 1:500,000. The mapped stratigraphic units include systems and selected groups, formations, and other stratigraphic units.
descript.purpose: BEDROCK_GEOL_MM48_IN was created to provide a digital coverage of the bedrock geology of the state of Indiana, suitable for use in a GIS, from a preexisting published paper map (Gray, H.H., Ault, C.H., and Keller, S.J., 1987, Bedrock Geologic Map of Indiana, Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 48). The mapped stratigraphic units include systems and selected groups, formations, and other stratigraphic units. This particular version of the shapefile was produced by the Indiana Geological Survey as part of an effort to populate the National Geothermal Data System (NGDS) with data in a digital form. This material is based upon work supported by the Department of Energy and the Arizona Geological Survey under Prime Award Number DE-EE0002850 and Sub-Award Number IN-EE002850.

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcGIS (v 10.0) shapefile format, Microsoft Windows 7 Enterprise, Approximately 3.7 Mb

attracc.attraccr:
The following note appears on the published source map (Gray et al., 1987): "Compiled from original data and published sources. Principal responsibilities: Keller, northern Indiana; Ault, Silurian, Middle Devonian, and Middle Pennsylvanian rocks; Gray, Upper Ordovician, Mississippian, and Lower Pennsylvanian rocks. Kentland area from unpublished work by Daniel S. Tudor. Knox and older units on cross-sections from unpublished work by John B. Droste. Drafted by Roger L. Purcell."
BEDROCK_GEOL_MM48_IN contains internal attributes with designations that refer to various bedrock stratigraphic units. The designations are the same as those appearing on the published map from which the shapefile was derived, with the following exception: within the field named "strata," the value of "D" includes both "D" and "D1."
Two tests for attribute consistency were performed by IGS personnel: (1) Values of each field were checked, using the QueryBuilder Tool in ESRI ArcView (a) Completeness of values was verified - All attribute values in the shapefile were confirmed to be present on the paper source map. - No values were left blank, unless appropriate. (b) Validity of values was verified - All values were checked for spelling and capitalization. (c) Relationships between fields were verified - The one-to-one relationship between values appearing in "strata" and "group" were verified, using the following example query statement: ([Strata] = "P2") and ([Group] <> "Carbondale Group"). (2) Using ESRI ArcView, the attributes of the shapefile were visually compared with a paper copy of the published source map. Such a comparison was made for every polygon.

dataqual.logic: ESRI ArcInfo polygon topology is present.
dataqual.complete:
The digital shapefile was derived with minor modifications from a preexisting published paper map (Gray et al., 1987) and is assumed to embody the same definitions and generalizations as were used in the creation of the published map.
BEDROCK_GEOL_MM48_IN contains internal attributes with designations that refer to various bedrock stratigraphic units. The designations are the same as those appearing on the published map from which the shapefile was derived, with the following exception: within the field named "strata," the value of "D" includes both "D" and "D1."

horizpa.horizpar: No records exist regarding horizontal positional accuracy of this shapefile. The coordinates used in georeferencing GEO500 (the predecessor of BEDROCK_GEOL_MM48_IN) were derived from the same Mylar separate (1:500,000 scale) as the geologic polygons. The following note appears on the published source map (Gray et al., 1987): "Base modified from U.S. Geological Survey Base Map of Indiana, 1973 edition." No quantitative tests were performed.

vertacc.vertaccr: Vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of BEDROCK_GEOL_MM48_IN. No quantitative tests were performed.

srcinfo.srccontr:
The attributes of this shapefile were derived by comparison with the attributes of the source paper map and the lines of the source Mylar separate.
The following note appears on the published source map (Gray et al., 1987): "Compiled from original data and published source. Principal responsibilities: Keller, northern Indiana; Ault, Silurian, Middle Devonian, and Middle Pennsylvanian rocks; Gray, Upper Ordovician, Mississippian, and Lower Pennsylvanian rocks. Kentland area from unpublished work by Daniel S. Tudor. Knox and older units on cross-sections from unpublished work by John B. Droste. Drafted by Roger L. Purcell."

procstep.procdesc: In the middle 1990s, the Mylar separate that had been used in the publication of Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 48 was acquired. The Mylar separate, which is on file with the Technology Transfer Section of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS), was then scanned by IGS personnel, using a black-and-white wide-bed scanner, to a digital raster image. The raster image was vectorized, using a tracer program. The vector data was georeferenced to UTM Zone 16, NAD27. The polygon coverage, named "GEO500," was then attributed, using the same stratigraphic designations that appear on Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 48.

The original coverage, GEO500, was first reprojected from UTM zone 16, NAD27 to UTM zone 16, NAD83 using ESRI ArcInfo (v 8.1). This coverage was then clipped to another coverage, INCLP83, containing the area within the 92 county boundaries for the state of Indiana, which was compiled at a scale of 1:24,000. Since GEO500 and INCLP83 boundaries did not coincide perfectly with one another, some polygons along the state boundary were either slightly truncated or slightly extended to the new boundary. In every case, the modifications were minor. The resulting coverage was converted to a shapefile named "BEDROCK_GEOL_MM48_IN."
An attribute field named "ROCK_TYPE" was added to the shapefile and populated with values obtained from the legend of Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 48.

An attribute field named "MORE_INFO" was added to the shapefile and populated with hyperlinks obtained from an online version of Ault and others, 1986, Compendium of Paleozoic rock-unit stratigraphy in Indiana--a revision: Bulletin 58, Indiana Geological Survey, Bloomington, Indiana.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit) and MP (Metadata Parser) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: Abbreviation for formation, group, or other stratigraphic unit as listed in the field named "Rock_Units."
Name of formation, group, or other stratigraphic unit
Generalized chacterization of the rock types associated with the rock units

Hyperlink to more detailed information regarding the rock units, provided by Ault and others, 1986, Compendium of Paleozoic rock-unit stratigraphy in Indiana--a revision: Bulletin 58, Indiana Geological Survey, Bloomington, Indiana.

distinfo.distliab:
It is requested that the Indiana Geological Survey be cited in any products generated from this data. The following source citation should be included: [BEDROCK_GEOL_MM48_IN: Bedrock Geology of Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, 1:500,000, Polygon Shapefile)]

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
